title: ABCDEF
text:
You are given a set S of integers between -30000 and 30000 (inclusive).Find the total number of sextuples (a, b, c, d, e, f): a, b, c, d, e, f ∈ S; d ≠ 0that satisfy:InputThe first line contains integer N (1 ≤ N ≤ 100), the size of a set S.Elements of S are given in the next N lines, one integer per line. Given numbers will be distinct.OutputOutput the total number of plausible sextuples.ExamplesInput:1
1Output:1Input:2
2
3Output:4Input:2
-1
1Output:24Input:3
5
7
10Output:10
